concise_definition: v. 承认, 准许进入, 招认

definitions.explanation_en: To acknowledge or accept the truth or existence of something, often reluctantly or after hesitation, especially when it is inconvenient or embarrassing.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指承认或接受某事的真实性或存在，通常是在犹豫或不情愿的情况下，尤其当该事令人不便或尴尬时。
definitions.example_en: He was finally admitting that he had made a mistake.
definitions.example_cn: 他终于承认自己犯了错误。

definitions.explanation_en: To allow someone or something to enter a place, organization, or system, often by official permission or under specific conditions.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指经正式许可或在特定条件下准许某人或某物进入某个场所、组织或系统。
definitions.example_en: The university is admitting 500 new students this fall.
definitions.example_cn: 这所大学今年秋天将录取500名新生。

definitions.explanation_en: To confess or declare something, especially a fault, crime, or wrongdoing, often under pressure or in a legal context.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指供认或声明某事，尤指在压力下或法律语境中承认过失、罪行或不当行为。
definitions.example_en: The suspect admitted to stealing the money during interrogation.
definitions.example_cn: 嫌疑人在审讯中承认了盗窃钱财的行为。

comparison.analysis: “Acknowledge” (承认) 更中性，常用于正式场合，表示认可事实、存在或权利，不一定带有情感负担或悔意。而 “admitting” 常隐含一种被迫、犹豫或内疚的情绪，尤其在承认错误时。
“Allow” (允许) 强调给予许可或不加阻止，是主动的授权行为，不涉及主观认知或坦白。而 “admitting” 在表示“准许进入”时，常隐含审查、筛选或限制的语境，如学校、医院等机构的准入机制。
“Confess” (坦白) 与 “admitting” 在“招认罪行”义项上高度重合，但 “confess” 更常用于宗教、道德或法律的严重过失，语气更庄重、情感更强烈，常带有赎罪或悔悟的意味；而 “admitting” 更通用，可用于日常或轻微的承认。
